intro: Thiodia laetioides, commonly known as the silverleaf thiodia, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Thiodia laetioides is adapted to withstand drought conditions due to its ability to store water in its leaves.
